channel.title: Team J-Program - YOUR Programming Helping Service
channel.description:
[img]http://i47.tinypic.com/24fcifs.png[/img]
[b][size=8pt]Who we are:[/size][/b] We are Team J-Program. We are a collaboration team, which specialize in any issue you may have, with any and all types of programming. This includes design and development outside the realm of RuneScape private servers as well. We are always on the lookout to recruit new team members.
[b][size=8pt]Why you should choose our assistance:[/size][/b] One of our goals is to gather the best of the best involved in the private server scene & general programming scenes, bring them here, and have them become a part of the team. We like to think that we function 'as one', or as a well-oiled machine. Any actual questions that are asked of us will be answered to the best of our abilities. If the person you seek help from is not experienced enough, you will be referred to someone who can assist you in your endeavors. Programming and design is our passion, and we would like to share our passion in the form of helping others.
[b][size=8pt]How to become a member of the Team:[/size][/b] You can express your interest in becoming a member of the Team, by sending a private message to any current Team member via the forums, or contact us through Skype, e-mail, IRC, etc. Alternatively, you can write a post in this thread expressing your interest. There are only two ways of having your application to join be denied: if [b]TWO or more[/b] people vouch against your application, or if you are not being active in the help sections (our team is for people to help the community. If you are not going to help, why be a part of the team?). Providing a reason towards an anti-vouch is not required, yet the Team is free to query the anti-voucher as needed.
[b][size=8pt]How to phrase your questions:[/size][/b] The questions asked should be well-worded, and as free of grammatical errors as possible. An ideal question will also be detailed and not a generalization. For example, rather than just posting "Help I don't know what to do," post, "Help, I encountered this specific bug/glitch/problem doing this specific action, and in an attempt to solve it, I wrote out this specific line(s) of code, but it is throwing me errors." If we see that an honest attempt to solve the problem was made, and you have general knowledge in programming (not making us waste time that could be spent helping others), then we will do our best to help. We are not meant to spoon-feed the answers or hold hands. If you don't know what you are doing, and it is a simple task, go learn basic Java before starting a private server.
[b][size=8pt]The people we are looking to recruit:[/size][/b] As a programming/design community, people are encouraged to and should be able to experience and learn new things as a whole. We're not only interested in having knowledge and sharing it, but sharing it in a way that everyone benefits from this. That is why we hope to expand this group as far as possible. What Team J-Program is looking for is as follows:
[ul][li]Java Programmers[list] [li]Private server Developers[/li][/list][/li] [li]Game content Designers[/li] [li]Website Developers & Designers[/li] [li]Database Developers[/li] [li]Ruby Developers[/li] [li]Python Developers[/li] [li]C Language Developers[/li] [li]Members fluent in any programming language[/li] [li]GFX Designers[/li] [li]Model Designers[/li] [li]Model Developers[/li][/ul]
[b][size=8pt]The Team:[/size][/b] Listed below are the members of Team J-Program. Within each is their Skype, e-mail, and/or any other available methods of reaching each member.
[ul][li]Flame_[/li] [list] [li]Skype: - soccer_flame14[/li] [li][url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=pm;sa=send;u=600800]Send me a PM![/url][/li] [/list][/ul]
[ul][li]Ruby[/li] [list] [li]Skype: - Ruby_website_developer[/li] [li]E-mail: - ctaylor_bh1@yahoo.co.uk[/li] [li][url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=pm;sa=send;u=534060]Send me a PM![/url][/li] [/list][/ul]
[ul][li]Sk8rdude461[/li] [list] [li]Skype: - sk8r_mopar[/li] [li]E-mail: - jessew@myself.com[/li] [li][url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=341531]Send me a PM![/url][/li] [/list][/ul]
[ul][li]Clawz fury[/li] [list] [li]Skype: - lare96.rsps[/li] [li]E-mail: - rshyrbid7@hotmail.com[/li] [li][url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=pm;sa=send;u=468771]Send me a PM![/url][/li] [/list][/ul]
[ul][li]t4[/li] [list] [li][url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/irc.php?img=0&host=irc.moparisthebest.com&channel=mopardev]Connect on the IRC Chatbox[/li] [/list][/ul]
[b]Alternatively, you can connect to us through the #moparscape or #help IRC channel through the IRC server irc.moparisthebest.xxx. Many believe IRC to be superior to any other methods of communication, and that is why Team J-Program is going to use it as well.[/b]
[b][size=8pt]Who should I ask for help in this group?[/size][/b] Good question! One of the reasons being a big group is so important is so that there are areas members can specialize in, thus giving the best results possible. If you are a member of Team J-Program and have an area you specialize in, let me know.
[ul][li]Flame_[/li] [list] [li]Java Programming[/li] [li]317 Protocol/Programming[/li] [li]Basic website design[/li] [list] [li]HTML + CSS[/li] [/list] [/list][/ul]
[ul][li]Ruby[/li] [list] [li]Website Developer[/li] [li]PHP[/li] [li]JavaScript[/li] [list][li]Node.js[/li] [li]jQuery[/li][/list] [li]SQL[/li] [li]CSS + HTML[/li] [li]SEO[/li] [/list][/ul]
[ul][li]Sk8rdude461[/li] [list] [li]Server setup[/li] [list] [li]Port forwarding[/li] [li]Basic 317 help[/li] [li]Jarring & Signing[/li] [/list][/list][/ul]
[ul][li]Clawz fury[/li] [list] [li]Java Programming[/li] [li]317 Protocol/Programming[/li] [/list][/ul]
[ul][li]t4[/li][list][li]Java Guru[/li][li]C Guru[/li][li](Mainly #377) Client Knowledge[/li][/list][/ul]
The goal of Team J-Program is to lean programmers of all levels in the right direction. Anyone who needs help, and knows to some extent what they are doing, will be helped. We are always going to be open to new team members, because this is a learning community.

item.title: Team J-Program - YOUR Programming Helping Service
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:212, topic:480450”]I’ve been working on that. I’ve got a short temper and it’s actually not easy to just control.
Mine is a real problem, unless he has some proof. I don’t see why he acts out the way he does.[/quote]I don’t know who you are, but I have just ran over a few posts that you have made the past few days in the help section after reading this post. Your “problem” is very controllable. It’s one thing to get easily mad, but saying things that are quite disrespectful due to one not understanding what you’re talking about is easily controllable. It’s called, “holding your tongue”. Instead of being a disrespectful little prick, you could come to them in an educated manner giving them help to the best of your abilities. You appear to start that way, but when individuals don’t quite understand what you’re talking about (they aren’t well experienced in Java, hence why they’re using that section to figure out basic problems), you get mad and start being disrespectful. Which isn’t a problem at all, you’re just being barbarous instead of holding your tongue.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

Ambokile:

Any reason votings are done publicly? If they were done privately it’d reduce any chance of a mob mentality

Mainly due to the fact that there are no organized meetings for the group, and as a result group members are free to post opinions on the matter within the thread.

PS - Group members have been voting against/in favor since before I even added the vote rule to the original thread.
